title: Barney Wolfe
text:
Wilbert Otto "Barney" Wolfe (January 9, 1876 – February 27, 1953) was a <a href="professional%20baseball">professional baseball</a> <a href="pitcher">pitcher</a>. He played four seasons in <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> for the <a href="New%20York%20Highlanders">New York Highlanders</a> and the <a href="Washington%20Senators%20%281901%E2%80%9360%29">Washington Senators</a> from 1903 to 1906. In 76 career games, he had 21 wins and 37 losses, with a 2.96 ERA. He batted and threw right-handed.
Wolfe was born in <a href="Independence%2C%20Pennsylvania">Independence, Pennsylvania</a>, and died in <a href="North%20Charleroi%2C%20Pennsylvania">North Charleroi, Pennsylvania</a>.
